name: Tokyo
description: Capital of Japan, blending tradition and modernity. Famous for Shibuya Crossing, Tokyo Tower, anime culture, and cutting-edge technology.

name: Kyoto
description: Ancient capital of Japan, known for its temples, shrines, and tea houses. A cultural treasure with geisha districts and seasonal festivals.

name: Osaka
description: Japan’s kitchen, famous for takoyaki and okonomiyaki. Known for Osaka Castle, Universal Studios Japan, and its vibrant nightlife.

name: Hiroshima
description: Historic city remembered for the Peace Memorial Park and Atomic Bomb Dome. Also known for Itsukushima Shrine and local okonomiyaki.

name: Sapporo
description: Capital of Hokkaido, popular for its Snow Festival, skiing, and beer. Famous for miso ramen and beautiful winter landscapes.

name: Nara
description: Japan’s first permanent capital, home to Todai-ji Temple and the Great Buddha. Famous for Nara Park where friendly deer roam freely.

name: Fukuoka
description: Major city on Kyushu Island, well-known for Hakata ramen and lively street food stalls. A hub for festivals and cultural exchange.

name: Yokohama
description: Port city near Tokyo with Japan’s largest Chinatown. Famous for Cup Noodles Museum, waterfront parks, and the Minato Mirai skyline.

name: Nagoya
description: Industrial hub and home of Toyota, with cultural landmarks like Nagoya Castle. Offers unique miso katsu cuisine and modern shopping areas.

name: Hakone
description: Famous hot spring resort town with views of Mount Fuji. Known for Lake Ashi cruises, Hakone Shrine, and scenic ropeways.
